body_content.explanation: to make a new or wider hole in something, especially in a cylinder in an engine (= the tube-shaped device inside which the part that causes the fuel to produce power moves up and down):
examples: The engine can be re-bored without taking it out of the vehicle.

body_content.explanation: the act of making a new or wider hole in something, especially in a cylinder in an engine (= the tube-shaped device inside which the part that causes the fuel to produce power moves up and down):
examples: When the engine was disassembled, it was found to need a rebore.
The gearbox was repaired and given a bearing change, including a re-bore.

body_content.explanation: a gun that could not previously fire real bullets that has been changed so that it can :
examples: The weapon is advertised as a rebore, an imitation gun that has been adapted to fire.
